article.Heading: Luxury cars to get dearer as GST cess may soon be hiked to 25%
article.Summary: The GST (Goods and Services Tax) Council had recommended an increase in the cap on cess of SUVs, large, mid-sized and luxury cars to 25 percent from 15 percent now.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol News

An ordinance allowing increase in cess on luxury cars is likely to be promulgated by the government within weeks, according to a Mint report.

The GST (Goods and Services Tax) Council had recommended an increase in the cap on cess of SUVs, large, mid-sized and luxury cars to 25 percent from 15 percent now.

The ordinance will make India's favourite sedans, such as Honda City, Maruti Ciaz, and nearly 50 others, dearer.

Prices of most of these vehicles had dropped 10-15 percent as excise, sales tax, VAT and other taxes like Octroi got subsumed under GST.

Under the new indirect tax regime, cars attract the top tax rate of 28 per cent. On top of this, a cess ofÂ 1-15 percent is currently levied to create a corpus to compensate states for loss of revenue from GST implementation.

The ordinance, meant to amend the Schedule to Section 8 of GST (Compensation to States) Act, 2017, will require the Finance Ministry's nod.

President Kovind will give the final nod and the ordinance will be taken up in the upcoming winter session.
